block.p: Carrie Kurtz, the daughter of Deborah and Charles E. Kurtz of Cheshire, Conn., was married yesterday to Daniel Chandra, the son of Lilac and Vijay Chandra of Fairfax Station, Va. The Rev. Thomas R. Schneider, a nondenominational minister, performed the ceremony at the Beaver Creek Chapel in Avon, Colo.

Mrs. Chandra, 33, is a senior vice president for strategy, sales and marketing at Capital IQ, a financial software company in New York. She graduated from the University of Vermont and received an M.B.A. from Georgetown.

Carrie Kurtz, the daughter of Deborah and Charles E. Kurtz of Cheshire, Conn., was married yesterday to Daniel Chandra, the son of Lilac and Vijay Chandra of Fairfax Station, Va. The Rev. Thomas R. Schneider, a nondenominational minister, performed the ceremony at the Beaver Creek Chapel in Avon, Colo.

Carrie Kurtz, the daughter of Deborah and Charles E. Kurtz of Cheshire, Conn., was married yesterday to Daniel Chandra, the son of Lilac and Vijay Chandra of Fairfax Station, Va. The Rev. Thomas R. Schneider, a nondenominational minister, performed the ceremony at the Beaver Creek Chapel in Avon, Colo.

Mrs. Chandra, 33, is a senior vice president for strategy, sales and marketing at Capital IQ, a financial software company in New York. She graduated from the University of Vermont and received an M.B.A. from Georgetown.

Her father retired as a manager of Kurtz Farms, a plant wholesaler in Cheshire. He is a consultant to CK Greenhouses, another Cheshire plant wholesaler, which is owned by her brother, Charles E. Kurtz Jr. of Cheshire. Her mother is the office manager there.

Mr. Chandra, 32, is a senior vice president and an investment analyst at Brencourt Advisors, a New York hedge fund. He graduated from Stanford and received an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania.
His father works in Herndon, Va., as a senior vice president in charge of the structures division at Parsons Brinckerhoff, the engineering company.
